metadata.title: CVE-2020-26555 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Bluetooth legacy BR/EDR PIN code pairing in Bluetooth Core Specification1.0B through 5.2 may permit an unauthenticated nearby device to spoof theBD_ADDR of the peer device to complete pairing without knowledge of thePIN.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26555` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1069-fips - 4.4.0-1069.75
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1069-fips - 4.4.0-1069.75
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1069-fips - 4.4.0-1069.75
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1069-fips - 4.4.0-1069.75
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
